alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 9:54AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...AREAS OF SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW TO CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... Areas of snow and blowing snow will continue across portions of the western Kenai Peninsula through early Friday afternoon as a storm system moves south of the region. Bands of snow are moving from east to west across the Kenai Peninsula this morning, and while most of the heavier snow will remain confined to the higher elevations, periods of snow are likely to continue west of the mountains, especially from Kenai south to Homer, through the next several hours. The combination of snow and gusty northerly winds may reduce visibility to as low as one half mile at times. Visibility may also be reduced along the Sterling Highway to the combination of snow, blowing snow, and resuspended snow from vehicular traffic. Travel may become difficult and motorists are urged to slow down and use caution. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
